content:
Educating yourself on mid-century modern design and furniture will help you make a more informed decision and appreciate your future purchase even more. Here are some excellent online resources and websites to get you started:

1. **MidCenturyModern.com**: A comprehensive online resource dedicated to mid-century modern design, architecture, and furniture. They feature articles, designer profiles, and a marketplace for buying and selling vintage and reproduction pieces.
2. **DesignWithinReach.com**: Although primarily an online furniture retailer, DWR has an excellent "Design Library" section that offers in-depth articles on mid-century modern designers, styles, and movements.
3. **ArchitecturalDigest.com**: Architectural Digest's website features a dedicated section on mid-century modern design, with articles, photo galleries, and designer profiles.
4. **Dwell.com**: Dwell is a great resource for modern design, and they frequently feature mid-century modern-inspired pieces and designers.
5. **1stdibs.com**: An online marketplace for high-end, vintage, and antique furniture. You can browse through their extensive collection of mid-century modern pieces and learn about designers, styles, and eras.
6. **Etsy.com**: While not exclusively mid-century modern, Etsy has a large collection of vintage and handmade items from the era. You can find unique pieces, learn about sellers, and get inspiration from the community.
7. **Pinterest.com**: Create boards and start pinning mid-century modern images to get a sense of the style, colors, and designs that resonate with you. You can also explore boards created by design enthusiasts and professionals.
8. **MidCenturyHome.com**: A blog dedicated to mid-century modern homes, furniture, and design. They feature articles, tours, and resources for renovating and decorating mid-century homes.
9. **The Spruce.com**: The Spruce has an extensive section on mid-century modern design, covering topics like furniture, decor, and architecture.
10. **Books and Documentaries**: There are many excellent books and documentaries on mid-century modern design. Some recommended books include "Mid-Century Modern: Furniture of the 1950s" by Cara Greenberg and "Eames Design: The Work of Charles and Ray Eames" by John Neuhart. Documentaries like "Eames: The Architect and the Painter" and "Dieter Rams: If You Don't Know Where You're Going, You'll Probably End Up Somewhere Else" are also worth watching.

These resources will provide you with a solid foundation in mid-century modern design and furniture. Take your time to explore, learn, and develop your eye for the style. When you're ready, you'll be confident in your purchase, and your new coffee table will be the perfect addition to your home.
